history.content:
I'm an Applied Math major potentially interested in finding work in ML, or a related field. However, I'm torn between whether or not I should pursue a Statistics minor or not. I thought about doing a CS or EECS minor, but I'm more interested in the mathematical side of the field, and would like to avoid taking 61C and EE 16A/B (I have already taken 61A/B).

If I go for a Stats minor, I'll be taking Linear Modeling (151A), Stochastic Processes (150), and Time Series (153), along with 134/135.

If I decide not to, it'll free up 2-3 class slots, allowing me to take classes I'm also interested in. It'll allow me to take EECS 126, which I wouldn't have time for for the previous option, along with a couple of other upper div. Math classes that I'm interested in.

Both options sound equally appealing to me, which is why it's so hard to decide. Will a statistics minor provide me with a competitive advantage? Or, is the difference trivial and comes down to preference of which classes I'd like to take? Any advice would be helpful. Thank you.
history.subject: Will a Statistics Minor be beneficial for doing work in ML?
